ab.p:
Once more
I’ll endeaver to write a few
lines to you.

I’m well and getting along
finely and I hope these few
lines will find you enjoying
the same blessings.

I was some what disapointed
last Eve in not receiving
a letter from Hornby. But
I suppose you’re all like my‐
=self have to wait till sunday
before you cand find time to write.

Friday Eve I received a letter
from Uncle Williams folks.
They seem to remember me oc‐
=casionally. I’ve written to them once.

I guess you would all
laugh if you should see my
writing desk. But you know that
necesity is the mother of invention.

This morning is cold and windy
and it reminds me of the
cold and bleak Februray mornings
that I’ve seen in old Hornby.

And when I think of one
thing it reminds me of many
others, of the kind and loving
Mother kind Brothers, and tender
Sisters, that I’ve left in my
own childhood home, to go forth
to fight the battles of my own
loved Country. Of the many
kind friend that I’ve spent
my youthful days among. I cannot
help off thinking off them nor neither
do I wish too. And I hope
that I shall so conduck myself
that when I return it may be
with a clear conscience that
I’ve done my duty.

How little did I think
one short year ago that I should
now be a soldier and undergoing
the rigors ofprivatation of camp life, how
different is the situations of
men. How cheqered is life.

But amoung the sodeldiers
omeone can find many friends
who will stand by him until
the last. There one finds all
kinds ofand classes. it is a
place where maen will show
their dispositions, each one
for himself is the most prevailing
complaint. But there is a light
as well as a dark side. there
are many pleasures, and if one
makes up his mind to take
things easy and make the best
of it he will get along well enough

We have moved into our barracks
and have been paid off up till
the first of January and the
first of next month we are
to be paid again. I guess I’ll
wait until next pay day before
I send any mony home. It
cost so much to send by Express
and the time is so short is why I
wait. We only get $ 13.00 per
month. I recd... $ 27.30 we got
pay from time of enlistment.

There was a considerable dissatisfaction
in regard to pay as they all enlisted
with the expectations of getting $ 14.00
per month. There was some talk
of our being sent in Gen. Lanes
Expedition to Texas Arizonia and
New Mexico. I wish theythey would send
us as I want to go. Good Bye
ab.ab: This from your Unworthy Sone William N. Harrison
